content: How many hours does it take for light from the Sun to reach Jupiter?

Light from the Sun takes approximately 43 minutes to reach Jupiter. This is because Jupiter is about 778 million kilometers away from the Sun on average, and light travels at a speed of about 299,792 kilometers per second. So, to calculate the time it takes for light to travel from the Sun to Jupiter, you can divide the distance by the speed of light:

Time = Distance / Speed
Time = 778,000,000 km / 299,792 km/s ≈ 2,596 seconds

Since there are 60 seconds in a minute, 2,596 seconds is approximately 43.27 minutes. So, it takes light about 43 minutes to travel from the Sun to Jupiter.
